scenario: SLB, an international oilfield services company, fell 24% in 2024 despite year-over-year beats in revenue and earnings. The company's fortunes are closely linked to the oil market, with record drilling in the United States suppressing oil prices. Analysts forecast earnings growth of 7.6% in the next 12 months and a consensus price target of $58.25, a 51% increase from its current level. SLB stock also offers a solid dividend with a 2.86% yield and a three-year average annualized growth rate of 4.5%. The trend is expected to favor new drilling, which supports giving SLB stock a look.
